channel.title: Custom items problem

item.title: Custom items problem
item.dc:creator: @williams15 williams15
item.description:
@williams15 wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:2, topic:555465”]The server is what assigns the slot for the item to go in. By default, it goes into the weapon slot.

Chances are you have code in your server already checking for “party hat” or “partyhat” in item names, however, your new items aren’t in the server.

Open up your item.cfg (or whatever your item definitions are loaded in) and add your custom items into it.[/quote]
figured it out thanks alot man

Read full topic

item.title: Custom items problem
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

The server is what assigns the slot for the item to go in. By default, it goes into the weapon slot.

Chances are you have code in your server already checking for “party hat” or “partyhat” in item names, however, your new items aren’t in the server.

Open up your item.cfg (or whatever your item definitions are loaded in) and add your custom items into it.

Read full topic

item.title: Custom items problem
item.dc:creator: @williams15 williams15
item.description:
@williams15 wrote:

added some customs such as phats and they equipt in hand ? how can i fix :S
eg.

case 9991: itemDef.modelid = 2635; itemDef.name = "Black Party-Hat"; itemDef.description = "A nice hat from a cracker."; itemDef.modelZoom = 440; itemDef.modelRotationY = 76; itemDef.modelRotationX = 1850; itemDef.modelOffset1 = 1; itemDef.modelOffset2 = -3; itemDef.stackable = false; itemDef.membersObject = true; itemDef.anInt165 = 187; itemDef.anInt200 = 363; itemDef.itemActions = new String[5]; itemDef.itemActions[1] = "Wear"; itemDef.itemActions[4] = "Drop"; itemDef.editedModelColor = new int[1]; itemDef.newModelColor = new int[1]; itemDef.editedModelColor[0] = 926; itemDef.newModelColor[0] = 1; break;
